hanzi-su-wiki:
詐

Значения

Лгать, обманывать

Мнемоника

Внезапные 乍 слова 言, которым пока верят — ложь.

Варианты

诈
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhà
to cheat; to swindle; to pretend; to feign; to draw sb out; to try to extract information by deceit or bluff
обманывать; мошенничать; притворяться; притворяться; вытягивать сб; пытаться добыть информацию обманным путем или блефом
rtega_mnemonic:
詐詐RS
诈诈		cheat, defraud, swindle, trick, feign
  • words 言 thrown into the air 乍
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 诈)
Pictophonetic: 乍 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 詐騙 [ zhà piàn ]: to defraud; to swindle; to blackmail
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 乍 [ zhà ] first time, for the first time, suddenly
heisig_chinese_memo: Pinnochio gets frustrated that every time he utters a word of a lie when he tries to swindle (cheat out of money) someone, his nose grows and he has to get the saw out again.
heisig_constituent: lie, say, words, keitai, mouth, saw
heisig_story: The lie in this character refers to falsehoods and fibs. Its elements: words . . . saw.
koohiiStory1: Pinnochio gets frustrated that every time he utters a word of a lie, his nose grows and he has to get the saw out again.
koohiiStory2: Her lies are words that cut not like a knife, no not cleanly, but savagely like a saw.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: They say the key to telling a lie is to totally believe the lie yourself. They say that if you believe your own lie, others will believe it as well. This is key.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine an actual key going from you to another person. This key is the lie. You gotta believe in the lie for it to reach the other person and unlock their understanding. Visualize this visual lie.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The lie you told was about not stealing your buddy’s saw (さ). You actually did steal his saw. He saw you steal his saw, but now you are trying to lie your way out of it. It’s not going well.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine trying to lie your way out of this. He saw you steal his saw. He caught you red handed. What sort of lie can you spin to get yourself out of this situation?
Kanshudo_mnemonic: although (乍) there are words (言), they're a lie
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This carpentar uses his fancy saw and words to swindle people out of their money when they pay too much for his poor work.
humanum_full_description_en:
The word " fraud " starts with " words " and " cha " is also pronounced. Takada Tadazhou believes that " cha " is both a sound symbol and a meaning symbol. Because " cha " means deeds, fraud and fraud are also deliberate words and deeds, so " cha " is also a sign. "Shuowen": "Fraud, deception. From words, first sound."

The text on the bamboo slips and silk may be from " words " and " work ", which means fraud, "Mawangdui silk script. The 18th line of the Old Unused Book before the Second Volume of Lao Zi: "Fake is not a child". "Mawangdui Silk Book. Lines 69-71 of "Chun Qiu Shi Yu": "Follow with his words." The character of " fraud " in the Chinese silk script from " made " can support Takada Tada's statement.

Jin Wentong falsely means " work ", which means forging, Zhongshan King Ding: "Zhongshan King-swindle (made) Ding." It means that Zhongshan King cast this tripod.

The Qin Bamboo Slips in the Late Warring States Period expressed fraud, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Yushu Jian 2: "The law is not enough, the people are more deceptive." It is also called " curse ", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Jian. Japanese Book No. 1 Jan. 17: "Li Yi said (getting off) Meng (union) fraud (cursing) and abandoning disease", which means that it is beneficial to lift the curse of the alliance and eliminate diseases.
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze text starts with " speak " and " at first " also sounds, the original meaning is fraud. "Shuowen": "Fraud, deception. From words, first sound."
humanum_full_description:
「詐」字從「言」，「乍」亦聲，高田忠周認為「乍」既是聲符，又是意符。因為「乍」表示作為，詐偽、欺詐也是一種刻意為之的言行，所以「乍」也是意符。《說文》：「詐，欺也。从言，乍聲。」

　　簡帛文字或從「言」，「作」亦聲，表示欺詐，《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本卷前古佚書》第18行：「詐偽不生」。《馬王堆帛書．春秋事語》第69-71行：「以其言詐之」。漢帛書「詐」字從「作」，可支持高田忠周的說法。

　　金文通假為「作」，表示鑄作，中山王鼎：「中山王□詐（作）鼎。」意謂中山王鑄造這個鼎。

　　戰國晚期秦簡表示欺詐，《睡虎地秦簡．語書》簡2：「法律未足，民多詐巧。」又通假為「詛」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書乙種》簡17：「利以說（脫）孟（盟）詐（詛）、棄疾」，意謂有利於解除盟誓詛咒、除去疾病。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「言」，「乍」亦聲，本義是欺詐。《說文》：「詐，欺也。从言，乍聲。」

詐欺(さぎ): fraud, swindle

「 詐 」字從「 言 」，「 乍 」亦聲，高田忠周認為「 乍 」既是聲符，又是意符。因為「 乍 」表示作為，詐偽、欺詐也是一種刻意為之的言行，所以「 乍 」也是意符。《說文》：「詐，欺也。从言，乍聲。」 簡帛文字或從「 言 」，「 作 」亦聲，表示欺詐，《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本卷前古佚書》第18行：「詐偽不生」。《馬王堆帛書．春秋事語》第69-71行：「以其言詐之」。漢帛書「 詐 」字從「 作 」，可支持高田忠周的說法。 金文通假為「 作 」，表示鑄作，中山王鼎：「中山王□詐（作）鼎。」意謂中山王鑄造這個鼎。 戰國晚期秦簡表示欺詐，《睡虎地秦簡．語書》簡2：「法律未足，民多詐巧。」又通假為「 詛 」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書乙種》簡17：「利以說（脫）孟（盟）詐（詛）、棄疾」，意謂有利於解除盟誓詛咒、除去疾病。
The word " fraud" starts with " words" and " cha" is also pronounced. Takada Tadazhou believes that " cha" is both a sound symbol and a meaning symbol. Because " cha" means deeds, fraud and fraud are also deliberate words and deeds, so " cha" is also a sign. "Shuowen": "Fraud, deception. From words, first sound." The text on the bamboo slips and silk may be from " words" and " work", which means fraud, "Mawangdui silk script. The 18th line of the Old Unused Book before the Second Volume of Lao Zi: "Fake is not a child". "Mawangdui Silk Book. Lines 69-71 of "Chun Qiu Shi Yu": "Follow with his words." The character of " fraud" in the Chinese silk script from " made" can support Takada Tada's statement. Jin Wentong falsely means " work", which means forging, Zhongshan King Ding: "Zhongshan King-swindle (made) Ding." It means that Zhongshan King cast this tripod. The Qin Bamboo Slips in the Late Warring States Period expressed fraud, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Yushu Jian 2: "The law is not enough, the people are more deceptive." It is also called " curse", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Jian. Japanese Book No. 1 Jan. 17: "Li Yi said (getting off) Meng (union) fraud (cursing) and abandoning disease", which means that it is beneficial to lift the curse of the alliance and eliminate diseases.

詐字的基本解释

詐
zhà
见“诈”。

詐字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhà］
［《廣韻》側駕切，去禡，莊。］
“诈1”的繁体字。
(1)欺骗。
(2)作假；假装。
(3)特指用兵奇诡多变，而诱使敌方判断错误的战术。
(4)谓用语言或手段骗人，诱使对方透露真情。
(5)漂亮；俊俏。
(6)通“乍”。突然。

詐字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　詐； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1154第20
【唐韻】【集韻】【正韻】側駕切【韻會】側嫁切，?柤zha去聲。【說文】欺也。【爾雅·釋詁】僞也。【正韻】詭譎也。【左傳·宣十五年】我無爾詐，爾無我虞。【禮·樂記】知者詐愚。【疏】謂欺詐愚人也。【周禮·地官·司市】以賈民禁僞而除詐。【疏】使禁物之僞。而去人之詐虛也。【晉書·?法志】背信藏巧謂之詐。【荀子·修身篇】匿行曰詐。【說苑·貴德篇】巧詐不如拙誠。　又卒也。【公羊傳·僖三十三年】詐戰不日。【註】詐，卒也。齊人語也。【疏】春秋之例，偏戰者日，詐戰者月。　又叶側下切，柤上聲。【王安石·寄曾鞏詩】吾能好諒直，世或非詭詐。叶上寫下者。　又叶莊助切，阻去聲。【晉語】詐之見詐，果喪其賂。【呂覽·情欲篇】意氣易動，蹻然不固。矜勢好智，胷中欺詐。　又叶側箇切，音佐。【前漢·敘傳】靡法靡度，民肆其詐。偪上幷下，荒殖其貨。

詐字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
詐字的起名意思

暂无。

Deceive
Basic explanation of words
Deceive
zhà
See "Fraud".
Deceive
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhà］
["Guangyun" drives sideways and cuts to Qi, Zhuang. ]
The traditional characters of "Fraud 1".
(1) Deception.
(2) Fake; pretend.
(3) In particular, it refers to the tactics in which the use of troops is bizarre and changeable to induce the enemy to make a wrong judgment.
(4) Said to deceive people by language or means to induce the other party to reveal the truth.
(5) Beautiful; handsome.
(6) Through "Zhang". suddenly.
Deceive
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[You Ji 1] [Words Department] 　Fraud; Kangxi strokes: 12; Page number: Page 1154 No. 20
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] Side drive cut [Rhyme will] Side marriage cut, "Tianzha go to sound." [Said the text] Deception. 【Erya·Shigu】False also. [Zhengyun] Curious too. [Zuo Zhuan·Xuan Fifteen Years] I have no deceit, no worries. 【Li·Le Ji】Those who know are foolish. 【Sparse】Fools are also called frauds. 【Zhou Li·Diguan·Sishi】To eliminate fraud by Jiamin's prohibition of counterfeiting. 【Sparse】make the forbidden thing fake. And to get rid of the deceitfulness of people. [Book of Jin·? Fazhi] Betrayal is a fraud. 【Xunzi·Self-cultivation】Hide and say fraud. [Said Yuan·Guide articles] Clever deception is not as good as Zhuocheng.　You die again. [Thirty-three Years of Gongyang Biography] Fraudulent wars are not long. [Note] Fraud, pawn. Qi people also speak. 【Sparse】In the Spring and Autumn Period, the day of the warriors and the month of the warriors.　The leaf cuts down again, and the sound comes up. [Wang Anshi·Send Zeng Gong Poems] I can forgive the straight, the world may be innocent. Writer on the leaf.　 Ye Zhuang helped to cut again, blocking the sound. [Jin language] Deception is deceived, and it is deceived to lose the bribe. [Lv Lan·Eros] Mood is easy to move, but not solid. He is so wise, he is cheating.　Leaf side cut, Otosuke. [Previous Han·Xu Chuan] The law was lavish, and the people wanted to deceive. Forced to go up and down, succumb to its goods.

zhà
вм. 诈
Radicals: 言, 乍  (say, key)
Meaning Mnemonic
They say the key to telling a lie is to totally believe the lie yourself. They say that if you believe your own lie, others will believe it as well. This is key.
Imagine an actual key going from you to another person. This key is the lie. You gotta believe in the lie for it to reach the other person and unlock their understanding. Visualize this visual lie.
Reading Mnemonic
The lie you told was about not stealing your buddy’s saw (さ). You actually did steal his saw. He saw you steal his saw, but now you are trying to lie your way out of it. It’s not going well.
Imagine trying to lie your way out of this. He saw you steal his saw. He caught you red handed. What sort of lie can you spin to get yourself out of this situation?
